item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18898)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “The Colorado Restaurant Association has been tapped to...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The Colorado Restaurant Association has been tapped to distribute $1 million to attract and retain workers under the “Denver Back to Work” program. The Colorado Event Alliance, an organization launched specifically to respond to the pandemic, will be in charge of another $500,000 for workers.”

Chefs, servers and others working in Denver’s hospitality industry may benefit from $1.5 million federal COVID-19 relief money that the City Council signed off on Monday night.

denverpost.com

Denver City Council OKs $1.5 million in grants for restaurant and hospitality workers

Chefs, servers and others working in Denver’s hospitality industry may benefit from $1.5 million federal COVID-19 relief money that the City Council signed off on Monday night.Chefs, servers and others working in Denver’s hospitality industry may benefit from $1.5 million federal COVID-19 relief money that the City Council signed off on Monday night.

item.title: “While the number of students immediately impacted is small,...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“While the number of students immediately impacted is small, education officials and proponents of the law say its significance is in the strides it makes toward ensuring equity and enhancing diversity.”

Colorado’s Senate Bill 29 grants in-state college tuition to members of 48 Indigenous tribes with historical ties to the state.

coloradosun.com

A new Colorado law granting Native Americans in-state college tuition is already attracting students

Colorado’s Senate Bill 29 grants in-state college tuition to members of 48 Indigenous tribes with historical ties to the state.Colorado’s Senate Bill 29 grants in-state college tuition to members of 48 Indigenous tribes with historical ties to the state.

item.title: “Coloradans who aren’t fully vaccinated were almost four...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Coloradans who aren’t fully vaccinated were almost four times as likely to be hospitalized for COVID-19 as of mid-August, suggesting that while the shots may have lost some effectiveness in preventing infections, they still greatly reduce the risk of severe illness.”

Coloradans who aren’t fully vaccinated were almost four times as likely as those who’ve been inoculated to be hospitalized for COVID-19 as of mid-August, suggesting that while the shots…

denverpost.com

Unvaccinated Coloradans almost 4 times as likely to be hospitalized for COVID-19

item.title: “It’s unclear when the national historic landmark that’s...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“It’s unclear when the national historic landmark that’s between the City and County Building and the statehouse will reopen to the public.”

Denver Mayor Michael Hancock said of the Sept. 15 closure that it’s “the people’s park and we are taking steps so that everyone can once again feel safe and welcomed there.”

denverpost.com

Denver will temporarily shut down Civic Center Park, citing health and safety

Denver Mayor Michael Hancock said of the Sept. 15 closure that it’s “the people’s park and we are taking steps so that everyone can once again feel safe and welcomed there.”Denver Mayor Michael Hancock said of the Sept. 15 closure that it’s “the people’s park and we are taking steps so that everyone can once again feel safe and welcomed there.”

item.title: “From new rules on how and when the powerful sedative ketamine...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“From new rules on how and when the powerful sedative ketamine can be administered in situations involving law enforcement to a ban on neck holds, Colorado lawmakers took steps in 2020 and 2021 that proponents of police reform hope will prevent unnecessary deaths and bolster accountability for law enforcement across the state.”

Elijah McClain’s death two years ago inspired a wave of new laws from the Colorado legislature and Gov. Jared Polis aimed at preventing something similar from ever happening again.

coloradosun.com

6 ways Colorado’s laws have recently changed to prevent another death like Elijah McClain’s

Elijah McClain’s death two years ago inspired a wave of new laws from the Colorado legislature and Gov. Jared Polis aimed at preventing something similar from ever happening again.Elijah McClain’s death two years ago inspired a wave of new laws from the Colorado legislature and Gov. Jared Polis aimed at preventing something similar from ever happening again.

item.title: “From new rules about how and when ketamine can be...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“From new rules about how and when ketamine can be administered to a ban on carotid and choke holds, Colorado lawmakers have taken steps to prevent a death like McClain’s from happening again.”

Representative Leslie Herod

Representative Leslie Herod was elected in 2016 as the first LGBTQ African American in the General Assembly. She is Chair of the House Finance Committee, Vice-Chair of the House Judiciary Committee and Chair of the Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.Representative Leslie Herod was elected in 2016 as the first LGBTQ African American in the General Assembly. She is Chair of the House Finance Committee, Vice-Chair of the House Judiciary Committee and Chair of the Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “AURORA, Colo — The death of Elijah McClain brought many new...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“AURORA, Colo — The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice. Many people assured his family they would fight for justice, including lawmakers.

“We're not divided. Give peace a chance, because it really does work,” Elijah’s mother, Sheneen McClain, said.

Sheneen McClain said those words at a protest in Denver on June 27, 2020. That day marked a new beginning for Sheneen and Colorado Rep. Leslie Herod.”

The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.

9news.com

Colorado leaders react to indictment in Elijah McClain case

The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.The death of Elijah McClain brought many new voices and faces together in the fight for justice.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Together, we believe that mental health should no longer take...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Together, we believe that mental health should no longer take a back-seat in people’s lives. Americans endured unprecedented stress and uncertainty over the last year and a half and communities of color are still suffering disproportionately from the pandemic. Through the Behavioral Health Assistance Program, we’re ensuring that the African American community in Denver is matched with therapists that ‘look like you’ and who understand the community’s needs when it comes to mental health.”

@centerforafricanamericanhealth
@amazon

  CAA Health is committed to being a good neighbor and through our new partnership with Amazon, we are continuing our mission to protect communities of color in Denver. Together, we believe that mental health should no longer take a back-seat in people’s lives. Americans endured unprecedented str...

caahealth.org

CAA Health and Amazon are Prioritizing mental health in Denver's underserved communities

CAA Health is committed to being a good neighbor and through our new partnership with Amazon, we are continuing our mission to protect communities of color in Denver. Together, we believe that mental health should no longer take a back-seat in people’s lives. Americans endured unprecedented str...  CAA Health is committed to being a good neighbor and through our new partnership with Amazon, we are continuing our mission to protect communities of color in Denver. Together, we believe that mental health should no longer take a back-seat in people’s lives. Americans endured unprecedented str...

item.title: “The stars and community leaders of Park Hill will be out and...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The stars and community leaders of Park Hill will be out and about Saturday, Aug. 28, for the fun-filled, history-packed Park Hill Day of Legends event at Skyland Park.

The event, hosted by the Park Hill Pirates Youth Sports Organization, will take place from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at the park located at 35th Avenue between Holly and Ivy Streets.”

Food trucks, bounce houses, music and more at Skyland Park.

denverite.com

Head out to Park Hill Saturday for the Pirates' Day of Legends event

Food trucks, bounce houses, music and more at Skyland Park.Food trucks, bounce houses, music and more at Skyland Park.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Representative Leslie HerodDan GibbsColorado Parks and Wildlife has extended the deadline to apply to be a Board member of the newly created...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodDan Gibbs

Colorado Parks and Wildlife has extended the deadline to apply to be a Board member of the newly created Outdoor Equity Grant Program, passed this legislative s...ession. The Program's goal is to increase access and opportunity for underserved youth and their families to experience Colorado's state parks and outdoor spaces.

The Board is a key part of our efforts to give more Coloradans the experience, joy, freedom, and inspiration of being in our vast great outdoors. It is also supported by Governor Jared Polis and Coloradans working to create more diverse outdoor spaces. Including champions Leslie Herod David Ortiz for Colorado Leroy M. Garcia Sonya Jaquez Lewis and many nonprofit partners including Next 100 Coalition: Public Lands for All Blackpackers GreenLatinos Latino Outdoors Colorado Environmental Learning for Kids Conservation Colorado Western Resource Advocates Continental Divide Trail Coalition The Colorado Nature Conservancy and many others as part of the Outdoor Equity Fund Coalition.

Apply today: https://cpw.state.co.us/abou…/Pages/Outdoor-Equity-Fund.aspx

See More
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: The Elevate Conservation Outdoors for All event is happening...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

The Elevate Conservation Outdoors for All event is happening now! Watch the live stream to learn about the Outdoor Equity Bill and other conservation efforts needed to benefit our environment. https://www.facebook.com/conservationcommunications/videos/4369516306427192/

Conservation Communications was live.

Please join Colorado and national conservation organizations, outdoor industry companies, and diverse community leaders as we honor the intersection of outdoor ...recreation and conservation, celebrate the ways we already work together, challenge ourselves to do more, and acknowledge how equitable policies are good for us all. Let’s come together to foster and maintain the integral roles that conservation, climate change mitigation, sound public lands policies, and equity play in supporting a successful outdoor industry.

SPEAKERS:
• José González will act as Emcee
• Senator Heinrich - Equity, Outdoor F.U.T.U.R.E. Initiative
• Vasu Sojitra - Equity/Inclusion/Accessibility, Outdoor F.U.T.U.R.E. Initiative
• Colorado Representative Leslie Herod - Sponsor of Colorado Outdoor Equity Bill
• Angelo Baca - Utah Diné Bikéyah

HONOREES:
• Outdoor F.U.T.U.R.E and Equity Grants programs in New Mexico, Colorado, & California
• Loretta Pineda, ELK - Environmental Learning for Kids and their Montbello Project
• Patricia Ann Cameron - Founder and Executive Director Blackpackers

SPONSORS:
• Grand Canyon Trust
• American Whitewater
• Fat Tire
• Conservation Communications
• The Wilderness Society
• Conservation Legacy
• Conservation Colorado
• National Wildlife Federation
• Bears Ears Intertribal Coalition
• Klean Kanteen
• Colorado Office of Outdoor Recreation
• Next 100 Coalition and Keystone Policy Center
• New Belgium Brewing Company
• Nuestra Tierra

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: I was honored to be part of the Black Women Town Hall last...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

I was honored to be part of the Black Women Town Hall last night! Watch the live stream here: https://www.facebook.com/watch/live/?v=431827264840759&ref=watch_permalink. We discussed the impact Black women have had on history, and how we can continue the progress to make MORE political changes.

March On was live.

2020 emphasized the power of Black Women and the work they have done to protect our democracy. Leading up to our day of Action on August 28th, we want to highli...ght the importance of Black Women and celebrate their work and leadership. Join us for a townhall at 7:45 PM EDT to uplift the power of Black Women.

See More

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM
